examples.turkish: Ekonomi, politika yapımında önemli bir rol oynar.

examples.english: They discussed the state of economics in the modern world.
examples.turkish: Modern dünyada ekonominin durumu hakkında konuştular.

english_meaning: a person who studies or is an expert in economics

examples.english: The economist predicted a recession in the coming year.
examples.turkish: Ekonomist gelecek yıl bir durgunluk öngördü.

examples.english: She is a renowned economist known for her insightful analysis.
examples.turkish: Derin analizleriyle tanınan ünlü bir ekonomisttir.

examples.english: Economists often debate the best strategies for economic growth.
examples.turkish: Ekonomistler, ekonomik büyüme için en iyi stratejileri tartışırlar.

english_meaning: relating to the commissioning or preparing of material for publication

examples.english: The newspaper published an editorial on climate change.
examples.turkish: Gazete iklim değişikliği üzerine bir köşe yazısı yayımladı.

examples.english: Her editorial opinion is highly respected by readers.
examples.turkish: Editoryal görüşleri okuyucular tarafından çok saygı görür.

examples.english: He contributed an editorial piece about education reform.
examples.turkish: Eğitim reformu üzerine editoryal bir makale yazdı.

english_meaning: a person who provides instruction or education; a teacher

examples.english: She is a dedicated educator who inspires her students.
examples.turkish: Öğrencilerine ilham veren adanmış bir eğitmendir.

examples.english: Educators play a crucial role in shaping future generations.
examples.turkish: Eğitmenler, gelecek nesilleri şekillendirmede hayati bir rol oynar.

examples.english: The conference brought together leading educators from around the world.
examples.turkish: Konferans, dünyanın dört bir yanından önde gelen eğitmenleri bir araya getirdi.

english_meaning: the degree to which something is successful in producing a desired result

examples.english: The effectiveness of the new policy was evident immediately.
examples.turkish: Yeni politikanın etkililiği hemen belli oldu.

examples.english: They measured the effectiveness of the training program.
Improved effectiveness in communication led to better teamwork.
examples.turkish: İletişimdeki artan etkililik, daha iyi takım çalışmasına yol açtı.

english_meaning: the ability to accomplish a job with a minimum expenditure of time and effort

examples.english: The new system improved the efficiency of the workflow.
examples.turkish: Yeni sistem, iş akışının verimliliğini artırdı.

examples.english: Efficiency in production is key to reducing costs.
They streamlined operations to boost overall efficiency.
examples.turkish: Genel verimliliği artırmak için operasyonları sadeleştirdiler.

english_meaning: in a well-organized and competent manner

examples.english: The team worked efficiently to complete the project ahead of schedule.
examples.turkish: Takım, projeyi planlanandan önce tamamlamak için verimli şekilde çalıştı.

examples.english: She managed her time efficiently.
The machine operates efficiently with minimal waste.
examples.turkish: Makine, az atıkla verimli şekilde çalışır.

english_meaning: a person's sense of self-esteem or self-importance

examples.english: His enormous ego often got in the way of teamwork.
examples.turkish: Büyük egosu, takım çalışmasının önüne geçti.

examples.english: She had to learn to set aside her ego in order to collaborate.
examples.turkish: İşbirliği yapabilmek için egosunu bir kenara koymayı öğrenmek zorunda kaldı.

examples.english: A healthy ego can boost confidence, but too much can be detrimental.
examples.turkish: Sağlıklı bir ego özgüveni artırabilir, ancak aşırı olması zararlı olabilir.

english_meaning: involving many careful details; intricate and complex

examples.english: The architect presented an elaborate design for the new building.
examples.turkish: Mimar, yeni bina için ayrıntılı bir tasarım sundu.

examples.english: Her elaborate explanation clarified the concept thoroughly.
examples.turkish: Onun kapsamlı açıklaması, kavramı tamamen netleştirdi.

examples.english: The wedding decorations were elaborate and stunning.
examples.turkish: Düğün süslemeleri ayrıntılı ve göz alıcıydı.

english_meaning: the joint between the forearm and the upper arm

examples.english: He accidentally hit his elbow on the table.
The athlete injured his elbow during the game.
She rested her head on her elbow while reading.

english_meaning: relating to elections or electors

examples.english: The electoral process in the country has been reformed.
Electoral laws are designed to ensure fair voting.
examples.turkish: Seçim yasaları adil oy kullanmayı sağlamak için tasarlanmıştır.

examples.english: They studied electoral systems as part of their political science course.
examples.turkish: Siyaset bilimi derslerinin bir parçası olarak seçim sistemlerini incelediler.

english_meaning: the branch of science or technology concerned with the design and application of circuits, devices, and systems

examples.english: He studied electronics engineering at university.
Modern electronics have revolutionized communication.
The store sells a variety of electronics, including smartphones and laptops.
examples.turkish: Mağaza, akıllı telefonlar ve dizüstü bilgisayarlar dahil olmak üzere çeşitli elektronik cihazlar satıyor.

english_meaning: pleasingly graceful and stylish in appearance or manner

examples.english: She wore an elegant dress to the formal event.
examples.turkish: Resmi etkinlikte zarif bir elbise giydi.

examples.english: The design of the building is both modern and elegant.
examples.turkish: Binanın tasarımı hem modern hem de şıktır.

examples.english: His elegant writing style impressed the critics.
examples.turkish: Onun zarif yazı stili eleştirmenleri etkiledi.

english_meaning: relating to the most basic aspects of something; fundamental

examples.english: The teacher explained the elementary principles of mathematics.
Elementary knowledge is required before advancing to higher studies.
examples.turkish: İleri düzey çalışmalara başlamadan önce temel bilgi gereklidir.

examples.english: He was taught elementary physics in school.

english_meaning: to raise or lift (something) to a higher position

examples.english: The coach's motivational speech helped elevate the team's performance.
examples.turkish: Antrenörün motive edici konuşması takımın performansını yükseltti.

examples.english: They plan to elevate the building by adding an extra floor.
examples.turkish: Binayı ekstra kat ekleyerek yükseltmeyi planlıyorlar.

examples.english: A good education can elevate your career prospects.
examples.turkish: İyi bir eğitim, kariyer olanaklarınızı yükseltebilir.

english_meaning: having the right to do or obtain something; meeting the necessary conditions

examples.english: Only citizens are eligible to vote in the election.
examples.turkish: Sadece vatandaşlar seçimde oy kullanmaya uygundur.

examples.english: She is eligible for a scholarship due to her academic performance.
examples.turkish: Akademik başarısı nedeniyle burs almaya uygundur.

examples.english: Candidates must be eligible to apply for the position.
examples.turkish: Adayların pozisyona başvurmaya uygun olması gerekir.

english_meaning: to completely remove or get rid of something

examples.english: The new software helped eliminate many errors in the system.
examples.turkish: Yeni yazılım, sistemdeki birçok hatayı ortadan kaldırdı.

examples.english: They worked hard to eliminate waste in the production process.
examples.turkish: Üretim sürecindeki atıkları yok etmek için çok çalıştılar.

examples.english: The campaign aims to eliminate illiteracy in the region.
examples.turkish: Kampanya, bölgede okuryazarlığı ortadan kaldırmayı hedefliyor.

english_meaning: a select group that is superior in terms of ability or qualities

examples.english: Only the elite athletes were invited to compete.
examples.turkish: Sadece seçkin sporcular yarışmaya davet edildi.

examples.english: The university is known for its elite research programs.
They belong to an elite group of professionals in the field.
examples.turkish: Alanında seçkin bir profesyoneller grubuna aitler.

english_meaning: to begin a journey or a venture

examples.english: They embarked on a journey around the world.
She decided to embark on a new career path.
examples.turkish: Yeni bir kariyer yoluna çıkmaya karar verdi.

examples.english: The company embarked on an ambitious expansion plan.
examples.turkish: Şirket, hırslı bir genişleme planına başladı.

english_meaning: a feeling of self-consciousness, shame, or awkwardness

examples.english: He felt deep embarrassment after tripping on stage.
examples.turkish: Sahneye düştükten sonra büyük bir mahcubiyet hissetti.

examples.english: Her embarrassment was obvious when she forgot her lines.
The mistake caused widespread embarrassment for the company.
examples.turkish: Hata, şirket için yaygın bir mahcubiyete yol açtı.

english_meaning: the official residence or offices of an ambassador in a foreign country

examples.english: She went to the embassy to apply for a visa.
examples.turkish: Vize başvurusu yapmak için büyükelçiliğe gitti.

examples.english: The embassy is located in the heart of the city.
Diplomatic relations are maintained through the embassy.

english_meaning: to fix (an object) firmly and deeply in a surrounding mass

examples.english: The journalist was embedded with the troops during the conflict.
examples.turkish: Gazeteci, çatışma sırasında askerlerle birlikte yerleştirildi.

examples.english: They embedded the sensor in the concrete wall.
The software allows you to embed videos in your website.
examples.turkish: Yazılım, web sitenize video yerleştirmenizi sağlar.

english_meaning: to give a tangible or visible form to an idea or quality

examples.english: The statue embodies the spirit of freedom.
Her actions embody the values of honesty and integrity.
examples.turkish: Davranışları, dürüstlük ve bütünlük değerlerini temsil ediyor.

examples.english: The film embodies the director's unique vision.
examples.turkish: Film, yönetmenin kendine özgü vizyonunu yansıtıyor.

english_meaning: to accept or support willingly and enthusiastically

examples.english: She decided to embrace the challenge with optimism.
The community embraced the new cultural initiative.
He embraced his role as a mentor wholeheartedly.
examples.turkish: Mentor rolünü tüm kalbiyle kabul etti.

english_meaning: the process of coming into existence or prominence

examples.english: The emergence of new technologies has changed the industry.
examples.turkish: Yeni teknolojilerin ortaya çıkışı sektörü değiştirdi.

examples.english: The emergence of the internet revolutionized communication.
There has been a rapid emergence of startups in the tech sector.
examples.turkish: Teknoloji sektöründe startup'ların hızla ortaya çıkışı oldu.

english_meaning: the act of releasing something, especially gas or radiation

examples.english: The factory was fined for excessive carbon emissions.
examples.turkish: Fabrika aşırı karbon salınımı yaptığı için para cezası aldı.

examples.english: Vehicle emissions are a major environmental concern.
examples.turkish: Araç salınımları büyük bir çevresel sorun teşkil ediyor.

examples.english: The emission of pollutants has decreased due to new regulations.
examples.turkish: Yeni düzenlemeler sayesinde kirletici gaz salınımı azaldı.

english_meaning: in a manner that relates to a person's emotions

examples.english: She reacted emotionally to the sad news.
examples.turkish: Üzgün habere duygusal olarak tepki verdi.

examples.english: He was emotionally moved by the touching performance.
examples.turkish: Dokunaklı performans onu duygusal olarak etkiledi.

examples.english: They spoke emotionally about their shared experiences.
examples.turkish: Ortak deneyimlerini duygusal bir şekilde anlattılar.

english_meaning: a group of states or countries under a single supreme authority

examples.english: The Roman Empire dominated much of Europe for centuries.
examples.turkish: Roma İmparatorluğu yüzyıllar boyunca Avrupa'nın büyük bölümünü kontrol etti.

examples.english: The empire expanded its territory through conquest.
Many ancient empires left a lasting impact on history.
examples.turkish: Pek çok antik imparatorluk tarihe kalıcı etkiler bıraktı.

english_meaning: based on observation or experience rather than theory

examples.english: The scientist relied on empirical evidence to support his theory.
examples.turkish: Bilim insanı, teorisini desteklemek için deneysel kanıtlara güvendi.

examples.english: Empirical research is essential for making informed decisions.
examples.turkish: Bilgili kararlar almak için deneysel araştırma şarttır.

examples.english: The study was based on empirical data collected over several years.
examples.turkish: Çalışma, birkaç yıl boyunca toplanan deneysel verilere dayanıyordu.

english_meaning: to give someone the authority or power to do something

examples.english: The organization aims to empower women in the community.
Educating the youth empowers them to create a better future.
examples.turkish: Gençleri eğitmek, onların daha iyi bir gelecek yaratmalarını sağlar.

examples.english: The program is designed to empower local entrepreneurs.
examples.turkish: Program, yerel girişimcileri güçlendirmek için tasarlanmıştır.

english_meaning: to make a bill or proposal law

examples.english: The government decided to enact new environmental regulations.
examples.turkish: Hükümet, yeni çevre düzenlemelerini yürürlüğe koymaya karar verdi.

examples.english: Parliament will enact the proposed amendments next month.
examples.turkish: Parlamento, önerilen değişiklikleri gelecek ay yürürlüğe koyacak.

examples.english: The committee is working to enact stricter safety standards.
examples.turkish: Komite, daha sıkı güvenlik standartlarını uygulamaya koymak için çalışıyor.

english_meaning: to include comprehensively; to surround and have or hold within

examples.english: The curriculum encompasses a wide range of subjects.
examples.turkish: Müfredat, geniş bir konu yelpazesini kapsar.

examples.english: Her work encompasses both art and technology.
examples.turkish: Onun çalışmaları hem sanatı hem de teknolojiyi kapsar.

examples.english: The park encompasses several hiking trails and lakes.
examples.turkish: Park, birkaç yürüyüş parkurunu ve gölü kapsar.

english_meaning: the act of giving someone support, confidence, or hope

examples.english: Her constant encouragement helped him overcome his fears.
examples.turkish: Sürekli teşviki, onun korkularını yenmesine yardımcı oldu.

examples.english: The coach's words of encouragement inspired the team.
examples.turkish: Antrenörün cesaret verici sözleri takımı motive etti.

examples.english: They offered encouragement during the difficult times.

english_meaning: giving someone support or confidence; hopeful

examples.english: Her encouraging words helped boost my confidence.
examples.turkish: Onun cesaret verici sözleri özgüvenimi artırdı.

examples.english: The teacher's encouraging attitude motivated her students.
examples.turkish: Öğretmenin teşvik edici tutumu, öğrencilerini motive etti.

examples.english: They received encouraging feedback on their project.
examples.turkish: Projeleri hakkında cesaretlendirici geri bildirim aldılar.

english_meaning: an attempt to achieve a goal; an effort

examples.english: Their scientific endeavor led to a breakthrough discovery.
examples.turkish: Bilimsel çabaları büyük bir keşfe yol açtı.

examples.english: She embarked on an endeavor to write a novel.
Hard work and determination are key to any endeavor.
examples.turkish: Her türlü çabada sıkı çalışma ve kararlılık anahtardır.

english_meaning: having no end or limit

examples.english: The desert seemed endless under the scorching sun.
examples.turkish: Çöl, kavurucu güneş altında sonsuz gibiydi.

examples.english: They enjoyed an endless summer of adventures.
examples.turkish: Sonsuz maceralar dolu bir yazın keyfini çıkardılar.

examples.english: Her endless curiosity led her to many discoveries.
examples.turkish: Sonsuz merakı, ona pek çok keşif getirdi.

english_meaning: to declare one's public approval or support of

examples.english: The celebrity endorsed the new product in a commercial.
examples.turkish: Ünlü, yeni ürünü bir reklamda onayladı.

examples.english: Several experts endorsed the proposal for reform.
He was asked to endorse the campaign for education reform.

english_meaning: an expression of approval or support, typically in the form of a recommendation

examples.english: The product gained credibility through a celebrity endorsement.
examples.turkish: Ürün, bir ünlü tarafından desteklenince güven kazandı.

examples.english: His endorsement of the policy swayed public opinion.
The film received an endorsement from several critics.

english_meaning: to suffer something painful or difficult patiently

examples.english: She had to endure a lot of hardships during her journey.
examples.turkish: Yolculuğu sırasında pek çok zorluğa katlanmak zorunda kaldı.

examples.english: He endured the criticism without complaint.
The team endured long hours of practice to win the championship.
examples.turkish: Takım, şampiyonluğu kazanmak için uzun saatler antrenman yaptı.

english_meaning: to compel observance of or compliance with (a law, rule, or obligation)

examples.english: The police enforce the traffic laws strictly.
examples.turkish: Polis, trafik kurallarını sıkı bir şekilde uygular.

examples.english: New policies are enforced to ensure workplace safety.
examples.turkish: İşyeri güvenliğini sağlamak için yeni politikalar uygulamaya kondu.

examples.english: The government will enforce the new regulations starting next month.
examples.turkish: Hükümet, yeni düzenlemeleri gelecek aydan itibaren uygulamaya koyacak.

english_meaning: the act of compelling observance of or compliance with a law, rule, or obligation

examples.english: Strict enforcement of the rules is necessary to maintain order.
examples.turkish: Kuralların sıkı uygulanması düzeni sağlamak için gereklidir.

examples.english: The enforcement of environmental regulations has improved air quality.
examples.turkish: Çevre düzenlemelerinin uygulanması hava kalitesini artırdı.

examples.english: Law enforcement agencies work tirelessly to combat crime.
examples.turkish: Emniyet güçleri, suçla mücadele için yorulmadan çalışır.

english_meaning: a formal agreement to get married; involvement or participation

examples.english: Their engagement was announced in the local newspaper.
Employee engagement is crucial for company success.
examples.turkish: Çalışanların işe bağlılığı, şirket başarısı için önemlidir.

examples.english: The engagement between the two parties led to a long-term partnership.
examples.turkish: İki taraf arasındaki anlaşma, uzun vadeli ortaklığa yol açtı.

english_meaning: attractive and interesting; capable of holding one's attention

examples.english: The speaker's engaging style captivated the audience.
The book is engaging and hard to put down.
examples.turkish: Kitap o kadar ilgi çekici ki bırakması zor.

examples.english: Her engaging personality made her very popular among peers.
examples.turkish: Onun ilgi çekici kişiliği, arkadaşları arasında çok popüler olmasını sağladı.

english_meaning: providing pleasure or delight

examples.english: The concert was truly enjoyable from start to finish.
They spent an enjoyable evening together.
The movie was enjoyable and well worth watching.

english_meaning: to improve or enhance the quality or value of something

examples.english: Traveling can enrich your understanding of different cultures.
examples.turkish: Seyahat etmek, farklı kültürleri anlamanı zenginleştirir.

examples.english: The program is designed to enrich students' knowledge.
examples.turkish: Program, öğrencilerin bilgisini zenginleştirmek için tasarlanmıştır.

examples.english: Reading extensively will enrich your vocabulary.
examples.turkish: Geniş çapta okumak kelime dağarcığını zenginleştirir.

english_meaning: to officially register as a member or participant in a course or institution

examples.english: She decided to enroll in a language course.
examples.turkish: Bir dil kursuna kaydolmaya karar verdi.

examples.english: Many students enroll at the university each year.
examples.turkish: Her yıl birçok öğrenci üniversiteye kaydolur.

examples.english: He enrolled in a training program to enhance his skills.
examples.turkish: Becerilerini geliştirmek için bir eğitim programına kaydoldu.

english_meaning: to happen or occur afterward or as a result
turkish_meaning: sonuç olarak ortaya çıkmak, peşinden gelmek

examples.english: After the argument, chaos ensued.
A period of uncertainty ensued following the announcement.
examples.turkish: Duyurudan sonra bir belirsizlik dönemi başladı.

examples.english: Trouble ensued when the plans fell through.

english_meaning: a project or undertaking, typically one that is difficult or requires effort

examples.english: Starting a new enterprise requires courage and perseverance.
examples.turkish: Yeni bir girişim başlatmak cesaret ve sebat gerektirir.

examples.english: The enterprise has grown into a multinational company.
examples.turkish: Girişim, çok uluslu bir şirkete dönüştü.

examples.english: They pooled their resources to launch the enterprise.

english_meaning: providing amusement or enjoyment

examples.english: The movie was both funny and entertaining.
examples.turkish: Film hem komik hem de eğlenceliydi.

examples.english: They organized an entertaining event for the community.
examples.turkish: Topluluk için eğlenceli bir etkinlik düzenlediler.

examples.english: Her performance was highly entertaining.

english_meaning: a person who is highly interested in a particular activity or subject

examples.english: He is a technology enthusiast who always keeps up with the latest trends.
examples.turkish: O, en son trendleri takip eden bir teknoloji meraklısıdır.

examples.english: The film attracted a large group of art enthusiasts.
examples.turkish: Film, çok sayıda sanat tutkununu çekti.

examples.english: As an enthusiast of classical music, she attends concerts regularly.
examples.turkish: Klasik müzik tutkunu olarak, düzenli olarak konserlere gider.

english_meaning: to give someone a right or claim to something

examples.english: Her excellent performance entitles her to a promotion.
examples.turkish: Mükemmel performansı, ona terfi hakkı tanır.

examples.english: The policy entitles all employees to a day off each year.
examples.turkish: Politika, tüm çalışanlara yılda bir gün izin hakkı verir.

examples.english: This achievement entitles him to recognition in his field.
examples.turkish: Bu başarı, ona kendi alanında tanınma hakkı tanır.

english_meaning: something that exists as a particular and discrete unit

examples.english: The corporation is considered a legal entity.
examples.turkish: Şirket yasal bir varlık olarak kabul edilir.

examples.english: Each department functions as an independent entity.
examples.turkish: Her departman bağımsız bir birim olarak işler.

examples.english: They formed a new entity to manage the merger.
examples.turkish: Birleşmeyi yönetmek için yeni bir yapı kurdular.

english_meaning: a person who organizes and operates a business, taking on financial risks to do so

examples.english: The young entrepreneur started his first company at age 22.
examples.turkish: Genç girişimci 22 yaşında ilk şirketini kurdu.

examples.english: Entrepreneurs drive innovation and economic growth.
examples.turkish: Girişimciler yeniliği ve ekonomik büyümeyi tetikler.

examples.english: She is a successful entrepreneur in the tech industry.

english_meaning: a flat paper container used to enclose a letter or document

examples.english: She sealed the letter in an envelope before mailing it.
examples.turkish: Mektubu göndermeden önce bir zarfa koyup kapattı.

examples.english: The envelope was decorated with a beautiful design.
He wrote his address on the envelope.

english_meaning: a widespread occurrence of an infectious disease in a community at a particular time

examples.english: The epidemic spread rapidly through the city.
Efforts to control the epidemic included vaccination campaigns.
examples.turkish: Salgını kontrol altına almak için aşı kampanyaları düzenlendi.

examples.english: The government declared a state of emergency during the epidemic.
examples.turkish: Salgın sırasında hükümet olağanüstü durum ilan etti.

english_meaning: the state of being equal, especially in status, rights, and opportunities

examples.english: They fought for equality in the workplace.
examples.turkish: İş yerinde eşitlik için mücadele ettiler.

examples.english: Equality is a fundamental human right.
Policies promoting equality have been implemented nationwide.
examples.turkish: Eşitliği teşvik eden politikalar ülke çapında uygulanmaya başlandı.

english_meaning: a mathematical statement that asserts the equality of two expressions

examples.english: Solve the equation for x.
The equation was too complex for most students.
examples.turkish: Denklem çoğu öğrenci için çok karmaşıktı.

examples.english: He derived a new equation to describe the phenomenon.
examples.turkish: O, olguyu açıklamak için yeni bir denklem türetti.

english_meaning: to supply with the necessary items for a particular purpose

examples.english: The hikers were equipped with all the necessary gear.
The laboratory is equipped with state-of-the-art instruments.
examples.turkish: Laboratuvar, en son teknoloji aletlerle donatılmıştır.

examples.english: They equipped the new office with modern furniture.
examples.turkish: Yeni ofisi modern mobilyalarla teçhiz ettiler.

english_meaning: equal in value, amount, function, meaning, etc.

examples.english: One kilogram is equivalent to 2.2 pounds.
His performance was equivalent to that of a seasoned professional.
examples.turkish: Onun performansı, deneyimli bir profesyonelle eşdeğerdi.

examples.english: They exchanged currencies at an equivalent rate.

english_meaning: a long and distinct period of history with a particular feature or characteristic

examples.english: The Victorian era was known for its strict social codes.
examples.turkish: Victoria dönemi, katı sosyal kurallarıyla bilinir.

examples.english: We are living in a digital era.
The era of rapid technological advancement is upon us.
examples.turkish: Hızlı teknolojik gelişim çağı üzerimize çökmüştür.

english_meaning: to build or put up (a building, wall, or other structure)

examples.english: They plan to erect a new office building downtown.
examples.turkish: Şehir merkezinde yeni bir ofis binası inşa etmeyi planlıyorlar.

examples.english: The monument was erected in memory of the fallen soldiers.
Local authorities erected barriers to control traffic.
examples.turkish: Yerel yetkililer trafiği kontrol etmek için bariyerler kurdu.

english_meaning: to burst forth suddenly and violently

examples.english: The volcano erupted, spewing lava for miles.
examples.turkish: Volkan patladı ve kilometrelerce lav püskürttü.

examples.english: Anger erupted among the crowd during the protest.
examples.turkish: Protesto sırasında kalabalık arasında öfke patlak verdi.

examples.english: Tensions erupted into violence after the announcement.

english_meaning: to increase rapidly; to intensify

examples.english: The conflict escalated quickly into a full-blown war.
examples.turkish: Çatışma hızla tam kapsamlı bir savaşa dönüştü.

examples.english: Prices continue to escalate due to high demand.
examples.turkish: Yüksek talep nedeniyle fiyatlar artmaya devam ediyor.

examples.english: The situation escalated after further disagreements.
examples.turkish: Daha fazla anlaşmazlıktan sonra durum yükseldi.

english_meaning: the intrinsic nature or indispensable quality of something that determines its character

examples.english: The essence of the novel is the struggle between good and evil.
examples.turkish: Romanın özü, iyilik ile kötülük arasındaki mücadeledir.

examples.english: She captured the essence of the moment in her painting.
Understanding the essence of the problem is the first step towards a solution.
examples.turkish: Sorunun özünü anlamak, çözüme giden ilk adımdır.

english_meaning: in essence; basically

examples.english: The two proposals are essentially the same.
Essentially, the problem is a lack of resources.
The project is essentially about improving efficiency.

english_meaning: an organized society, institution, or business

examples.english: The establishment of the new law marked a turning point in society.
examples.turkish: Yeni yasanın yürürlüğe girmesi toplumda bir dönüm noktasıydı.

examples.english: He is a respected member of the artistic establishment.
examples.turkish: O, sanat çevresinin saygın bir üyesidir.

examples.english: The establishment has been criticized for its outdated practices.
examples.turkish: Kuruluş, modası geçmiş uygulamaları nedeniyle eleştiriliyor.

english_meaning: lasting or existing forever; without end

examples.english: They believed in eternal love.
The ancient monument has an eternal quality.
examples.turkish: Antik anıtın sonsuz bir havası var.

examples.english: Many philosophers have pondered the concept of the eternal.
examples.turkish: Pek çok filozof, sonsuzluk kavramını düşündü.

english_meaning: a set of moral principles, especially ones relating to or affirming a specified group, field, or person

examples.english: He is known for his strong work ethic.
The company's ethics are at the core of its success.
Ethics play a crucial role in professional conduct.
examples.turkish: Mesleki davranışta etik çok önemli bir rol oynar.

english_meaning: relating to a population subgroup with a common national or cultural tradition

examples.english: The city is known for its diverse ethnic communities.
They celebrated an ethnic festival that showcased traditional music and dance.
examples.turkish: Geleneksel müzik ve dansın sergilendiği etnik bir festival düzenlediler.

examples.english: Ethnic cuisine offers a taste of different cultures.
examples.turkish: Etnik mutfak, farklı kültürlerin lezzetlerini sunar.

english_meaning: to remove (someone) from a place of danger to a safer location

examples.english: Residents were ordered to evacuate due to the approaching hurricane.
examples.turkish: Yaklaşan kasırga nedeniyle sakinlerin tahliye edilmesi emredildi.

examples.english: The building was evacuated after the fire alarm went off.
examples.turkish: Yangın alarmı çaldıktan sonra bina tahliye edildi.

examples.english: Authorities advised people to evacuate the area immediately.
examples.turkish: Yetkililer, bölgeden derhal tahliye olmalarını tavsiye etti.

english_meaning: the process of judging or determining the significance, worth, or quality of something

examples.english: The evaluation of the project took several weeks.
They conducted an evaluation of the new software.
Her performance received a positive evaluation from the critics.
examples.turkish: Performansı, eleştirmenlerden olumlu bir değerlendirme aldı.

english_meaning: plain or obvious; clearly seen or understood

examples.english: It was evident from his tone that he was upset.
The solution to the problem became evident after some thought.
examples.turkish: Sorunun çözümü biraz düşündükten sonra açıkça görüldü.

examples.english: Her passion for the subject was evident in her presentation.
examples.turkish: Konuya olan tutkusu sunumundan belli oluyordu.

english_meaning: to bring or recall a feeling, memory, or image to the conscious mind

examples.english: The music evoked memories of her childhood.
His speech evoked a strong emotional response from the audience.
examples.turkish: Konuşması, dinleyicilerde güçlü duygusal tepkiler uyandırdı.

examples.english: The painting evoked a sense of nostalgia.

english_meaning: the gradual development of something, especially from a simple to a more complex form

examples.english: The evolution of technology has transformed our lives.
They studied the evolution of species over millions of years.
examples.turkish: Milyonlarca yıl boyunca türlerin evrimini incelediler.

examples.english: The evolution of the internet has reshaped global communication.
examples.turkish: İnternetin evrimi küresel iletişimi yeniden şekillendirdi.

english_meaning: relating to the gradual development of something

examples.english: They discussed the evolutionary changes in the species.
The evolutionary process has shaped the diversity of life on Earth.
examples.turkish: Evrimsel süreç, Dünya üzerindeki yaşam çeşitliliğini şekillendirdi.

examples.english: Her theory presented an evolutionary perspective on social change.
examples.turkish: Onun teorisi, toplumsal değişime evrimsel bir bakış açısı getirdi.

english_meaning: to develop gradually, especially from a simple to a more complex form

examples.english: Over the years, the company evolved into a market leader.
examples.turkish: Yıllar içinde şirket, pazar lideri haline geldi.

examples.english: Species evolve over time to adapt to their environment.
examples.turkish: Türler, çevrelerine uyum sağlamak için zamanla evrilir.

examples.english: Her style evolved as she gained more experience.
examples.turkish: Daha fazla deneyim kazandıkça tarzı evrildi.

english_meaning: to represent something as being larger, better, or worse than it really is

examples.english: He tends to exaggerate his achievements.
Don't exaggerate the difficulties; it's not as bad as it seems.
examples.turkish: Zorlukları abartma; göründüğü kadar kötü değil.

examples.english: The media sometimes exaggerates the impact of events.

english_meaning: to be greater in number, size, or degree than something else

examples.english: The company's profits exceeded all expectations.
Sales exceeded the targets for the quarter.
examples.turkish: Satışlar, çeyrek için belirlenen hedefleri aştı.

examples.english: Her abilities exceed those of her peers.

english_meaning: the quality of being outstanding or extremely good

examples.english: Her pursuit of excellence in her work is admirable.
examples.turkish: İşindeki mükemmelliğe ulaşma çabası takdire şayandır.

examples.english: The school is renowned for its excellence in academics.
Striving for excellence is key to success.

english_meaning: a person or thing that is excluded from a general statement or does not follow a rule

examples.english: There is no exception to the rule.
She is the only exception in an otherwise strict class.
His performance was an exception to his usual standard.
examples.turkish: Onun performansı, alışılmış standardının dışında bir istisnaydı.

english_meaning: unusually good; outstanding

examples.english: She has an exceptional talent for music.
examples.turkish: Müzik konusunda olağanüstü bir yeteneğe sahip.

examples.english: The restaurant offers exceptional service.
His work is exceptional in its quality and detail.
examples.turkish: Onun işi, kalitesi ve detayları açısından olağanüstü.

english_meaning: an amount that is more than necessary; too much

examples.english: There was an excess of food at the party.
Excess speed is a common cause of accidents.
examples.turkish: Aşırı hız, kazaların yaygın bir nedenidir.

examples.english: The store sold products in excess of the demand.

english_meaning: more than is necessary, normal, or desirable; immoderate

examples.english: Excessive noise can cause hearing damage.
examples.turkish: Aşırı gürültü işitme hasarına yol açabilir.

examples.english: He was criticized for his excessive spending.
Too much sun exposure can lead to excessive skin damage.
examples.turkish: Çok fazla güneş ışığı, aşırı cilt hasarına neden olabilir.

english_meaning: to deliberately leave something or someone out; to not include

examples.english: The club's membership rules exclude non-residents.
examples.turkish: Kulübün üyelik kuralları, yerleşik olmayanları dışlar.

examples.english: They decided to exclude the outdated data from the report.
examples.turkish: Raporu hazırlarken eski verileri dışlamaya karar verdiler.

examples.english: He felt excluded from the decision-making process.

english_meaning: the process or state of excluding or being excluded

examples.english: There is a strict policy of exclusion for certain materials.
examples.turkish: Belirli materyaller için katı bir dışlama politikası vardır.

examples.english: Social exclusion remains a major issue in many cities.
examples.turkish: Sosyal dışlanma birçok şehirde önemli bir sorundur.

examples.english: The exclusion of minorities from the community is unacceptable.

english_meaning: restricted to a particular person, group, or area; not shared with others

examples.english: They have an exclusive contract with the supplier.
The club is exclusive and admits only a limited number of members.
examples.turkish: Kulüp özel olup sınırlı sayıda üye kabul eder.

examples.english: The magazine offers exclusive interviews with celebrities.

english_meaning: only; solely

examples.english: The club is exclusively for members only.
She exclusively uses organic ingredients in her recipes.
examples.turkish: Yemek tariflerinde yalnızca organik malzemeler kullanır.

examples.english: The service is exclusively available online.

english_meaning: to carry out or put into effect (a plan, order, or course of action)

examples.english: The manager will execute the new marketing strategy next month.
examples.turkish: Yönetici, gelecek ay yeni pazarlama stratejisini uygulayacak.

examples.english: They executed the project with precision and care.
examples.turkish: Projeyi titizlikle ve özenle icra ettiler.

examples.english: The computer program was executed without any errors.

english_meaning: the act of carrying out a plan or order; also, the carrying out of a death sentence

examples.english: The execution of the plan was flawless.
They criticized the execution of the project.
The prisoner faced execution after a long trial.
examples.turkish: Uzun süren bir duruşmanın ardından mahkum infaz cezasıyla karşı karşıya kaldı.

english_meaning: to apply or bring to bear (a force, influence, or quality)

examples.english: She had to exert a lot of effort to complete the marathon.
examples.turkish: Maratonu tamamlamak için çok çaba sarf etmek zorunda kaldı.

examples.english: The coach encouraged the players to exert themselves on the field.
examples.turkish: Antrenör, oyuncuların sahada ellerinden geleni yapmalarını teşvik etti.

examples.english: He exerted considerable influence on the decision.

english_meaning: the state of being barred from one's native country, typically for political or punitive reasons

examples.english: The writer spent many years in exile.
Political exile forced him to leave his homeland.
examples.turkish: Siyasi sürgün, onun memleketinden ayrılmasına neden oldu.

examples.english: Exile often leads to feelings of loneliness and loss.
examples.turkish: Sürgün, genellikle yalnızlık ve kayıp duygularına yol açar.

english_meaning: originating in or characteristic of a distant foreign country

examples.english: They admired the exotic fruits at the market.
The museum displayed exotic artifacts from Asia.
Her dress featured an exotic pattern that stood out.
examples.turkish: Elbisesi, dikkat çeken egzotik bir desen içeriyordu.

english_meaning: the process of becoming larger or more extensive

examples.english: The expansion of the company into new markets was successful.
examples.turkish: Şirketin yeni pazarlara genişlemesi başarılı oldu.

examples.english: Urban expansion has led to the loss of natural habitats.
examples.turkish: Kentsel genişleme, doğal yaşam alanlarının kaybına yol açtı.

examples.english: They announced plans for the expansion of the facility.

english_meaning: a journey undertaken for a specific purpose, often involving exploration

examples.english: The expedition to the Arctic was both dangerous and exciting.
examples.turkish: Arktik seferi hem tehlikeli hem de heyecan vericiydi.

examples.english: They organized an expedition to study the wildlife in the area.
examples.turkish: Bölgedeki vahşi yaşamı incelemek için bir keşif gezisi düzenlediler.

examples.english: The expedition lasted several months in harsh conditions.
examples.turkish: Keşif gezisi, zorlu koşullar altında birkaç ay sürdü.

english_meaning: the action of spending funds; an amount of money spent

examples.english: The government's expenditure on education has increased significantly.
examples.turkish: Hükümetin eğitime yaptığı harcamalar önemli ölçüde arttı.

examples.english: They carefully monitored their expenditure to stay within budget.
examples.turkish: Bütçe dahilinde kalabilmek için harcamalarını dikkatlice izlediler.

examples.english: Expenditure on healthcare is a major concern for many nations.
examples.turkish: Sağlık hizmetlerine yapılan harcamalar pek çok ülke için büyük bir endişedir.

english_meaning: relating to or based on experiments; innovative and unproven

examples.english: They conducted experimental research in the lab.
The experimental design of the study was groundbreaking.
She is known for her experimental approach to art.

english_meaning: specialized skill or knowledge in a particular field

examples.english: Her expertise in digital marketing is highly valued.
The company hired consultants for their financial expertise.
examples.turkish: Şirket, finansal uzmanlık için danışmanlar tuttu.

examples.english: He shared his expertise on the subject during the seminar.
examples.turkish: Seminer sırasında konu hakkındaki uzmanlığını paylaştı.

english_meaning: to come to an end; (of a period of validity) to terminate

examples.english: The coupon will expire at midnight.
Her passport expired last month and needs to be renewed.
examples.turkish: Pasaportu geçen ay süresi doldu ve yenilenmesi gerekiyor.

examples.english: The contract will expire at the end of the year.

english_meaning: stated clearly and in detail, leaving no room for confusion or doubt

examples.english: The instructions were explicit and easy to follow.
examples.turkish: Talimatlar açık ve takip etmesi kolaydı.

examples.english: He gave explicit directions to avoid any misunderstanding.
examples.turkish: Herhangi bir yanlış anlamayı önlemek için net yönergeler verdi.

examples.english: The contract contains explicit terms regarding payment.
examples.turkish: Sözleşme, ödeme ile ilgili açık hükümlere sahiptir.

english_meaning: in a clear and detailed manner, leaving no room for confusion

examples.english: The guidelines explicitly state the requirements.
She explicitly warned him about the potential risks.
examples.turkish: Olası riskler hakkında onu açıkça uyardı.

examples.english: The policy was explicitly explained during the meeting.

english_meaning: to make full use of and derive benefit from a resource; to take unfair advantage of

examples.english: The company exploited new market opportunities.
He was accused of exploiting his workers.
They exploited every resource available to complete the project.
examples.turkish: Projeyi tamamlamak için mevcut her kaynaktan yararlandılar.

english_meaning: the action of making use of and benefiting from resources, often unfairly or unethically

examples.english: The documentary highlighted the exploitation of natural resources.
Workers protested against the exploitation by their employer.
examples.turkish: İşçiler, işverenleri tarafından sömürülmeye karşı protesto etti.

examples.english: Exploitation of labor remains a serious issue in many industries.
examples.turkish: İş gücünün sömürülmesi birçok sektörde ciddi bir sorundur.

english_meaning: able or likely to shatter violently or burst apart; a substance that explodes

examples.english: The explosive material was safely detonated by the experts.
examples.turkish: Uzmanlar tarafından patlayıcı madde güvenli bir şekilde havaya uçuruldu.

examples.english: Her comments had an explosive impact on the discussion.
examples.turkish: Sözleri tartışmaya patlayıcı bir etki yaptı.

examples.english: They stored the explosive in a secure facility.
examples.turkish: Patlayıcı maddeyi güvenli bir tesiste sakladılar.

english_meaning: the state of being exposed to contact with something, such as risk, danger, or a stimulus

examples.english: Prolonged exposure to the sun can damage your skin.
examples.turkish: Uzun süre güneşe maruz kalmak cildinize zarar verebilir.

examples.english: The documentary provided exposure to life in remote areas.
examples.turkish: Belgesel, uzak bölgelerdeki yaşamı gözler önüne serdi.

examples.english: Media exposure helped boost his public image.
examples.turkish: Medya maruziyeti, onun kamu imajını güçlendirdi.

english_meaning: an addition to something that enlarges or prolongs it; a prolongation

examples.english: They requested an extension on the deadline.
The house has a modern extension that adds extra space.
examples.turkish: Eve ekstra alan kazandıran modern bir ek yapılmıştır.

examples.english: An extension cord was used to power the device.
examples.turkish: Cihazı çalıştırmak için bir uzatma kablosu kullanıldı.

english_meaning: covering or affecting a large area; wide-ranging

examples.english: They conducted an extensive survey of the region.
The library has an extensive collection of rare books.
examples.turkish: Kütüphane, nadir kitapların geniş bir koleksiyonuna sahiptir.

examples.english: Extensive research was carried out before the project began.
examples.turkish: Proje başlamadan önce kapsamlı araştırmalar yapıldı.

english_meaning: to a great extent; widely

examples.english: The subject was extensively covered in the textbook.
examples.turkish: Konu ders kitabında kapsamlı biçimde işlendi.

examples.english: They traveled extensively throughout Europe.
The new software was extensively tested before release.
examples.turkish: Yeni yazılım, piyasaya sürülmeden önce kapsamlı şekilde test edildi.

english_meaning: to remove or take out, especially by effort or force; a substance extracted from something

examples.english: The dentist had to extract the damaged tooth.
examples.turkish: Diş hekimi, hasarlı dişi çıkarmak zorunda kaldı.

examples.english: They extracted valuable data from the research.
Vanilla extract is used to flavor desserts.
examples.turkish: Tatlılara lezzet vermek için vanilya özü kullanılır.

english_meaning: a person who holds extreme political or religious views, especially one who advocates radical measures

examples.english: The extremist group was responsible for the attack.
Authorities arrested several extremists planning a protest.
examples.turkish: Yetkililer, protesto düzenlemeyi planlayan birkaç radikali tutukladı.

examples.english: Extremists often resort to violence to achieve their goals.
examples.turkish: Radikaller, hedeflerine ulaşmak için sıklıkla şiddete başvururlar.

english_meaning: a material, typically produced by weaving or knitting textile fibers

examples.english: The dress was made from a soft, luxurious fabric.
examples.turkish: Elbise yumuşak, lüks bir kumaştan yapılmıştı.

examples.english: They chose a durable fabric for the upholstery.
examples.turkish: Kaplama için dayanıklı bir kumaş seçtiler.

examples.english: Silk is a natural fabric prized for its texture and shine.
examples.turkish: İpek, dokusu ve parlaklığıyla değer verilen doğal bir kumaştır.

english_meaning: extraordinarily good or wonderful

examples.english: They had a fabulous time at the beach party.
Her performance was simply fabulous.
The view from the mountain was absolutely fabulous.

english_meaning: to make an action or process easier or more likely to happen

examples.english: The new software will facilitate faster data processing.
examples.turkish: Yeni yazılım, daha hızlı veri işlemeyi kolaylaştıracak.

examples.english: Good communication skills facilitate effective teamwork.
examples.turkish: İyi iletişim becerileri etkili takım çalışmasını kolaylaştırır.

examples.english: They hired a consultant to facilitate the project implementation.
examples.turkish: Projeyi hayata geçirmek için bir danışman tuttular.

english_meaning: a small organized dissenting group within a larger one, especially in politics

examples.english: A faction within the party opposed the new policy.
examples.turkish: Parti içinde yeni politikaya karşı çıkan bir grup vardı.

examples.english: Internal factionalism weakened the organization's unity.
The faction demanded more power in the negotiations.
examples.turkish: Grup, müzakerelerde daha fazla güç talep etti.

english_meaning: the teaching staff of a university or college; a natural ability

examples.english: The university faculty is renowned for its research.
He has a remarkable faculty for languages.
examples.turkish: Diller konusunda olağanüstü bir yeteneği var.

examples.english: The faculty met to discuss curriculum changes.
examples.turkish: Akademik kadro, müfredat değişikliklerini görüşmek için toplandı.

english_meaning: to gradually grow faint and disappear; to lose brightness or distinctness

examples.english: The colors of the painting began to fade over time.
Her memory of the event has faded with the years.
examples.turkish: Olay hakkındaki anıları yıllarla birlikte soldu.

examples.english: The sound of the music faded into the distance.

english_meaning: not successful; not achieving the desired aim

examples.english: The project was a failed attempt at innovation.
His failed efforts were met with disappointment.
The failed experiment led to new research directions.
examples.turkish: Başarısız deney, yeni araştırma yönlerine yol açtı.

english_meaning: the quality of making judgments that are free from discrimination

examples.english: The judge was praised for her commitment to fairness.
examples.turkish: Hakimin, adalete olan bağlılığı övgü aldı.

examples.english: Fairness in the workplace is essential for employee morale.
examples.turkish: İş yerinde adalet, çalışan moralinin temelidir.

examples.english: They demanded fairness in the distribution of resources.

english_meaning: not genuine; counterfeit or imitation

examples.english: He was arrested for selling fake designer handbags.
examples.turkish: Sahte tasarım çantaları sattığı için tutuklandı.

examples.english: The painting was proven to be a fake.
She felt deceived by the fake news article.
examples.turkish: Sahte haber makalesi yüzünden kandırıldığını hissetti.

english_meaning: the state of being widely known or recognized

examples.english: He gained fame as a talented actor.
examples.turkish: Yetenekli bir aktör olarak ün kazandı.

examples.english: The singer's fame spread across the country.
Many aspiring artists dream of achieving fame.
examples.turkish: Birçok genç sanatçı şöhret elde etmeyi hayal eder.

english_meaning: an imaginative or fanciful idea, often unrealistic

examples.english: The novel is a blend of reality and fantasy.
She escaped into a world of fantasy to avoid reality.
examples.turkish: Gerçeklikten kaçmak için hayal dünyasına daldı.

examples.english: Children often indulge in wild fantasies.
examples.turkish: Çocuklar sık sık çılgın hayallere kapılırlar.

english_meaning: the money a passenger must pay for a journey on public transportation

examples.english: The bus fare has increased over the years.
She paid the taxi fare in cash.
They discussed reducing the fare for public transport.

english_meaning: causing death; very severe or critical

examples.english: The accident proved to be fatal for several passengers.
examples.turkish: Kaza, birkaç yolcu için ölümcül sonuçlar doğurdu.

examples.english: A fatal error in the system caused a shutdown.
examples.turkish: Sistemdeki ölümcül hata, kapanmaya neden oldu.

examples.english: The virus is considered fatal if not treated promptly.
examples.turkish: Virüs, zamanında tedavi edilmezse ölümcül kabul edilir.

english_meaning: the development of events beyond a person's control; destiny

examples.english: Many believe that fate controls our lives.
examples.turkish: Birçok kişi kaderin hayatımızı kontrol ettiğine inanır.

examples.english: He resigned himself to his fate.
The novel explores the interplay of fate and free will.
examples.turkish: Roman, kader ile özgür irade arasındaki etkileşimi inceliyor.

english_meaning: expressing approval; advantageous

examples.english: The weather was favorable for the outdoor event.
examples.turkish: Açık hava etkinliği için hava elverişliydi.

examples.english: They received favorable reviews for their performance.
A favorable market condition can boost business growth.
examples.turkish: Elverişli piyasa koşulları, iş büyümesini artırabilir.

english_meaning: an achievement that requires great courage, skill, or strength

examples.english: Climbing Mount Everest is an extraordinary feat.
examples.turkish: Everest Dağı'na tırmanmak olağanüstü bir başarıdır.

examples.english: Her feat in the competition impressed everyone.
Completing the marathon was a remarkable feat of endurance.
examples.turkish: Maratonu tamamlamak olağanüstü bir dayanıklılık başarısıydı.

english_meaning: a serious crime, typically one punishable by imprisonment for more than one year or by death

examples.english: He was charged with a felony after the incident.
examples.turkish: Olaydan sonra ağır suçlamalarla karşı karşıya kaldı.

examples.english: Felony convictions can have long-lasting consequences.
examples.turkish: Ağır suçlardan mahkumiyet, uzun süreli sonuçlara yol açabilir.

examples.english: The prosecutor sought a felony indictment for the suspect.
examples.turkish: Savcı, şüpheli için ağır suç iddiasında bulundu.

english_meaning: relating to the advocacy of women's rights on the basis of equality of the sexes; a person who supports feminism

examples.english: She is a prominent feminist in the literary community.
examples.turkish: O, edebiyat camiasında önde gelen bir feministtir.

examples.english: The feminist movement has brought significant changes to society.
examples.turkish: Feminist hareket, toplumda önemli değişikliklere yol açtı.

examples.english: He identifies as a feminist and supports gender equality.
examples.turkish: Kendini feminist olarak tanımlıyor ve cinsiyet eşitliğini destekliyor.

english_meaning: a thread or filament from which a vegetable tissue, mineral substance, or textile is formed

examples.english: Dietary fiber is essential for healthy digestion.
examples.turkish: Beslenme lifi sağlıklı sindirim için gereklidir.

examples.english: Cotton fiber is used to make soft, breathable fabrics.
examples.turkish: Pamuk lifi, yumuşak ve nefes alabilen kumaşlar yapmak için kullanılır.

examples.english: The fabric is made from a blend of synthetic and natural fibers.
examples.turkish: Kumaş, sentetik ve doğal liflerin karışımından yapılmıştır.

english_meaning: having or displaying an intense, aggressive, or powerful quality

examples.english: The fierce competition in the market forced companies to innovate.
examples.turkish: Piyasadaki şiddetli rekabet, şirketleri yenilik yapmaya zorladı.

examples.english: Her fierce determination helped her overcome obstacles.
examples.turkish: Onun şiddetli kararlılığı, engelleri aşmasına yardımcı oldu.

examples.english: The fierce storm caused widespread damage.
examples.turkish: Şiddetli fırtına geniş çaplı hasara neden oldu.

english_meaning: a person who makes films, especially someone who directs or produces them

examples.english: The filmmaker received critical acclaim for his latest movie.
examples.turkish: Film yapımcısı, son filmiyle eleştirmenlerden övgü aldı.

examples.english: She aspires to become a renowned filmmaker.
examples.turkish: Ünlü bir film yapımcısı olmayı hedefliyor.

examples.english: The filmmaker attended several international film festivals.
examples.turkish: Film yapımcısı, birçok uluslararası film festivaline katıldı.

english_meaning: a device for removing impurities or solid particles from a liquid or gas; to pass a liquid, gas, light, or sound through a filter

examples.english: The coffee machine has a built-in water filter.
examples.turkish: Kahve makinesinde yerleşik bir su filtresi bulunur.

examples.english: She filtered the water before drinking it.
The photograph was enhanced using a color filter.

english_meaning: of high quality; to impose a financial penalty

examples.english: The artist is known for his fine paintings.
He was fined for speeding on the highway.
examples.turkish: Otoyolda hız yaptığı için ceza yedi.

examples.english: Please fine-tune the settings on the device.

english_meaning: a weapon that discharges a projectile by the action of an explosive

examples.english: The suspect was found in possession of an unregistered firearm.
examples.turkish: Şüpheli, kayıtsız bir ateşli silahla bulununca yakalandı.

examples.english: Strict laws regulate the sale of firearms.
examples.turkish: Ateşli silahların satışı sıkı yasalarla düzenlenir.

examples.english: The museum displayed historic firearms from the 19th century.
examples.turkish: Müze, 19. yüzyıldan kalma tarihi ateşli silahları sergiledi.

english_meaning: a person whose job is to extinguish fires and rescue people from danger

examples.english: The firefighter rescued the family from the burning building.
examples.turkish: İtfaiyeci, yanmakta olan binadan aileyi kurtardı.

examples.english: Firefighters worked tirelessly to control the blaze.
examples.turkish: İtfaiyeciler, yangını kontrol altına almak için yorulmadan çalıştı.

examples.english: She always admired the bravery of firefighters.
examples.turkish: Her zaman itfaiyecilerin cesaretine hayran kalmıştır.

english_meaning: having a solid, almost unyielding surface or structure; strongly held

examples.english: He held a firm belief in his principles.
The table had a firm surface that didn't wobble.
examples.turkish: Masanın sarsılmayan sağlam bir yüzeyi vardı.

examples.english: She gave a firm handshake to greet him.
examples.turkish: Onunla selamlaşırken sağlam bir el sıkışma yaptı.

english_meaning: in a strong, steady, or resolute manner

examples.english: She held the rope firmly to secure her position.
examples.turkish: Konumunu korumak için ipi sağlam bir şekilde tuttu.

examples.english: He firmly believes that hard work pays off.
examples.turkish: Sıkı çalışmanın karşılığını alacağına kesinlikle inanıyor.

examples.english: The decision was firmly made after lengthy discussions.
examples.turkish: Uzun tartışmaların ardından karar kesinlikle verildi.

english_meaning: relating to government revenue, especially taxes

examples.english: The government announced new fiscal policies to boost the economy.
examples.turkish: Hükümet, ekonomiyi canlandırmak için yeni mali politikalar açıkladı.

examples.english: Fiscal responsibility is essential for financial stability.
examples.turkish: Mali sorumluluk, finansal istikrar için esastır.

examples.english: The fiscal year ends in June.
examples.turkish: Mali yıl Haziran ayında sona erer.

english_meaning: the condition of being of the right shape, size, or quality; suitable

examples.english: He was in perfect fit for the athletic competition.
examples.turkish: Spor müsabakası için mükemmel durumda idi.

examples.english: The fit of the garment was tailored to perfection.
examples.turkish: Kıyafetin uygunluğu kusursuz bir şekilde dikilmişti.

examples.english: She is a great fit for the role because of her experience.
examples.turkish: Deneyimi sayesinde rol için çok uygundur.

english_meaning: the distinctive taste of a food or drink

examples.english: The soup had a rich, savory flavor.
examples.turkish: Çorbanın zengin, lezzetli bir tadı vardı.

examples.english: She added herbs to enhance the flavor of the dish.
examples.turkish: Yemeğin lezzetini artırmak için otlar ekledi.

examples.english: The ice cream is known for its unique flavor combinations.

english_meaning: a mark, fault, or other imperfection that mars a substance or object

examples.english: The designer noticed a flaw in the fabric.
examples.turkish: Tasarımcı kumaşta bir kusur fark etti.

examples.english: No product is completely free of flaws.

examples.turkish: Planın kusuru, nihai başarısızlığa yol açtı.

english_meaning: brought to or showing the presence of faults or mistakes; imperfect

examples.english: The theory was interesting but fundamentally flawed.
Her argument was flawed due to unsupported assumptions.
They had to revise the flawed design.
examples.turkish: Kusurlu tasarımı yeniden gözden geçirmek zorunda kaldılar.

english_meaning: to run away from a place or situation of danger

examples.english: The villagers had to flee when the wildfire spread.
examples.turkish: Orman yangını yayıldığında köylüler kaçmak zorunda kaldı.

examples.english: He fled the country to escape persecution.
The criminal attempted to flee the scene.

english_meaning: a group of ships, vehicles, or aircraft operating together or under the same ownership

examples.english: The naval fleet sailed into the harbor at dawn.
A fleet of trucks delivered the supplies on time.
examples.turkish: Bir dizi kamyon, malzemeleri zamanında teslim etti.

examples.english: The airline announced plans to expand its fleet.

english_meaning: the soft substance consisting of muscle and fat that is found between the skin and bones of an animal or human

examples.english: The cut was deep, and blood flowed from the exposed flesh.
examples.turkish: Yara derindi ve açığa çıkan etten kan aktı.

examples.english: He lost a lot of flesh in the accident.
The artist captured the delicate texture of human flesh in his painting.
examples.turkish: Ressam, resminde insan etinin ince dokusunu yakaladı.

english_meaning: the quality of bending easily without breaking; the willingness to change or compromise

examples.english: Yoga helps improve flexibility and strength.
examples.turkish: Yoga, esnekliği ve gücü artırmaya yardımcı olur.

examples.english: The job offers flexibility in work hours.
Her flexibility in adapting to new situations is admirable.
examples.turkish: Yeni durumlara uyum sağlama esnekliği takdire şayandır.

english_meaning: to grow or develop in a healthy or vigorous way; to thrive

examples.english: The garden flourished under her careful attention.
examples.turkish: Bahçe, onun özenli bakımı altında bereketlendi.

examples.english: The business began to flourish after the new strategy was implemented.
examples.turkish: Yeni stratejinin uygulanmasından sonra işletme gelişmeye başladı.

examples.english: Creativity flourishes in an environment that encourages experimentation.
examples.turkish: Deneyimi teşvik eden bir ortamda yaratıcılık gelişir.

english_meaning: a substance that has no fixed shape and yields easily to external pressure; a liquid

examples.english: Water is a fluid that adapts to the shape of its container.
examples.turkish: Su, kabın şeklini alan bir sıvıdır.

examples.english: The artist used fluid brush strokes to create a dynamic painting.
examples.turkish: Sanatçı, dinamik bir resim oluşturmak için akıcı fırça darbeleri kullandı.

examples.english: The fluid dynamics of the river were studied by scientists.
examples.turkish: Nehir akışkan dinamikleri, bilim insanları tarafından incelendi.

english_meaning: having an affection or liking for something

examples.english: She is very fond of classical music.
He became fond of his new colleagues quickly.
The child was fond of playing in the park.

english_meaning: a person who acts unwisely or imprudently; someone who is easily deceived

examples.english: Don't be such a fool; think before you act.
examples.turkish: Bu kadar aptal olma; hareket etmeden önce düşün.

examples.english: He was called a fool for believing the rumor.
examples.turkish: Söylentiye inandığı için ona aptal denildi.

examples.english: The movie portrayed a lovable fool who always meant well.
examples.turkish: Film, her zaman iyi niyetli olan sevimli bir budalayı konu aldı.

english_meaning: raw, unedited material as filmed by movie cameras

examples.english: The documentary included rare footage of wildlife.
examples.turkish: Belgeselde nadir hayvan görüntüleri yer aldı.

examples.english: They reviewed the footage to identify the suspect.
The director selected the best footage for the final cut.
examples.turkish: Yönetmen, son montaj için en iyi çekimleri seçti.

english_meaning: to order someone not to do something; to prohibit

examples.english: The teacher forbade the students from using mobile phones in class.
examples.turkish: Öğretmen, öğrencilerin sınıfta cep telefonu kullanmalarını yasakladı.

examples.english: Smoking is forbidden in public buildings.
They forbid the use of plastics in the office to reduce waste.
examples.turkish: Atıkları azaltmak için ofiste plastik kullanımını yasakladılar.

english_meaning: a prediction or estimate of future events, especially coming weather or trends; to predict

examples.english: The weather forecast predicts rain tomorrow.
examples.turkish: Hava durumu tahmini yarın yağmur bekliyor.

examples.english: Experts forecast a significant growth in the economy.
examples.turkish: Uzmanlar, ekonomide önemli bir büyüme öngörüyor.

examples.english: He forecast a change in market trends.

english_meaning: a person from another country

examples.english: The city is known for its diverse population of foreigners.
examples.turkish: Şehir, çeşitli yabancı nüfusu ile tanınır.

examples.english: He felt like a foreigner in his own hometown.

examples.turkish: Buraya, benzersiz kültürü deneyimlemek için sık sık yabancılar gelir.

english_meaning: to form or make, especially by concentrated effort; to create a relationship or bond

examples.english: They forged a strong partnership over the years.
examples.turkish: Yıllar içinde güçlü bir ortaklık kurdular.

examples.english: The blacksmith forged a new sword from raw iron.
examples.turkish: Demir ustası ham demirden yeni bir kılıç yaptı.

examples.english: He forged ahead with his plans despite the obstacles.
examples.turkish: Engellere rağmen planlarına kararlı bir şekilde devam etti.

english_meaning: the way in which something is arranged or set out

examples.turkish: Yeni kitap modern bir formata sahiptir.

examples.english: Please check the format of your document before submitting.
examples.turkish: Lütfen teslim etmeden önce belgenizin formatını kontrol edin.

examples.english: The conference presentation was organized in a clear format.
examples.turkish: Konferans sunumu açık bir formatta düzenlendi.

english_meaning: the action of forming or process of being formed; a particular arrangement or structure

examples.english: The formation of the mountain range took millions of years.
examples.turkish: Dağ sırasının oluşumu milyonlarca yıl sürdü.

examples.english: The formation of clouds indicates a change in the weather.

english_meaning: in the past; used to indicate something that used to be the case

examples.english: She was formerly known as a leading researcher in her field.
examples.turkish: Önceden kendi alanında önde gelen bir araştırmacı olarak biliniyordu.

examples.english: The building was formerly used as a warehouse.

english_meaning: a set form of words or symbols used in mathematics or science to express a rule or principle

examples.english: The chemist wrote down the chemical formula for water.

examples.turkish: Projenin başarısı yeni bir formüle dayanıyordu.

examples.english: She learned the formula for calculating interest rates in class.
examples.turkish: Derste faiz oranını hesaplama formülünü öğrendi.

english_meaning: to create or prepare methodically; to express in a systematic way

examples.english: They formulated a plan to reduce pollution.
examples.turkish: Kirliliği azaltmak için bir plan formüle ettiler.

examples.english: The scientist formulated a new hypothesis based on the data.
examples.turkish: Bilim insanı, verilere dayanarak yeni bir hipotez oluşturdu.

examples.english: It took hours to formulate a clear response.
examples.turkish: Net bir yanıt oluşturmak saatler sürdü.

english_meaning: outward; forward in time or order

They set forth a plan for the future expansion of the business.
examples.turkish: İşletmenin gelecekteki genişlemesi için bir plan ortaya koydular.

english_meaning: about to appear or take place; friendly and receptive in manner

examples.english: The forthcoming book is highly anticipated.
examples.turkish: Yakında çıkacak kitap büyük merakla bekleniyor.

examples.english: She was very forthcoming with details about the project.
examples.turkish: Proje hakkında detayları paylaşmada çok samimiydi.

examples.english: The company issued a statement about its forthcoming plans.
examples.turkish: Şirket, gelecek planları hakkında bir açıklama yaptı.

english_meaning: favored by or involving good luck; lucky

examples.turkish: Kazadan sağ çıkmayı kendilerine talih olarak gördüler.

english_meaning: a meeting or medium where ideas and views on a particular issue can be exchanged

examples.english: The town hall served as a forum for public debate.
examples.turkish: Belediye salonu, halk tartışmaları için bir forum olarak hizmet verdi.

examples.english: They organized a forum to discuss environmental issues.
examples.turkish: Çevresel sorunları tartışmak için bir forum düzenlediler.

examples.english: Online forums allow people from around the world to share ideas.
examples.turkish: Çevrimiçi forumlar, dünyanın dört bir yanından insanların fikir alışverişi yapmasına olanak tanır.

english_meaning: the remains or impression of a prehistoric organism preserved in rock

examples.english: The paleontologists discovered a rare fossil in the desert.
examples.turkish: Paleontologlar, çölde nadir bir fosil buldu.

examples.english: Fossils provide valuable information about ancient life.
examples.turkish: Fosiller, antik yaşam hakkında değerli bilgiler sunar.

examples.english: The museum displayed a collection of dinosaur fossils.
examples.turkish: Müze, dinozor fosillerinden oluşan bir koleksiyon sergiledi.

english_meaning: to encourage the development of something (typically something desirable)

examples.english: The organization aims to foster creativity in young people.
examples.turkish: Kuruluş, gençler arasında yaratıcılığı teşvik etmeyi amaçlıyor.

examples.english: Parents play a key role in fostering a love of reading.
examples.turkish: Ebeveynler, okuma sevgisinin gelişiminde kilit rol oynar.

examples.english: They fostered an environment of mutual respect.

english_meaning: the lowest load-bearing part of a building; the basis or groundwork of anything

examples.english: The foundation of the building was reinforced to prevent collapse.
examples.turkish: Binanın temeli, çöküşü önlemek için güçlendirildi.

examples.english: A strong education is the foundation of a successful career.
examples.turkish: Güçlü bir eğitim, başarılı bir kariyerin temelidir.

examples.english: They laid the foundation for a new community center.
examples.turkish: Yeni bir toplum merkezi için temel atıldı.

english_meaning: a person who establishes an institution or settlement; one who originates something

examples.english: The founder of the company started it in his garage.

examples.turkish: O, başarılı bir teknoloji girişiminin kurucusudur.

examples.english: The founder's vision continues to influence the organization.
examples.turkish: Kurucunun vizyonu, örgütü etkilemeye devam ediyor.

english_meaning: a small or tiny part, amount, or proportion of something

examples.english: Only a fraction of the population was affected by the policy.
examples.turkish: Nüfusun sadece küçük bir kısmı politika tarafından etkilendi.

examples.english: She solved the problem by reducing it to a simple fraction.
examples.turkish: Sorunu, basit bir kesire indirerek çözdü.

examples.english: A fraction of the funds was allocated for research.
examples.turkish: Fonların küçük bir kısmı araştırma için ayrıldı.

english_meaning: easily broken or damaged; delicate

examples.english: Handle the glassware with care; it is very fragile.
examples.turkish: Cam eşyaları dikkatlice kullanın; çok kırılgandır.

examples.english: The fragile ecosystem is threatened by pollution.
Her fragile health required constant monitoring.
examples.turkish: Onun kırılgan sağlığı sürekli izlenmeyi gerektiriyordu.

english_meaning: a small part broken off or separated from something

examples.english: A fragment of the ancient pottery was discovered at the site.
examples.turkish: Antik seramikten bir parça, alanda keşfedildi.

examples.english: The novel is full of fragments of memories.
He found a fragment of paper in his old books.
examples.turkish: Eski kitaplarında bir kağıt parçası buldu.

english_meaning: a basic structure underlying a system, concept, or text

examples.english: The legal framework for the new law was complex.
examples.turkish: Yeni yasa için yasal çerçeve karmaşıktı.

examples.english: They developed a framework to guide the project.
examples.turkish: Projeyi yönlendirmek için bir çerçeve geliştirdiler.

examples.english: The framework of the organization supports its mission.

english_meaning: an authorization granted by a government or company to an individual or group to carry out specified commercial activities

examples.english: He bought a franchise of a popular fast-food chain.
examples.turkish: Popüler bir fast-food zincirinin bayiliğini aldı.

examples.english: The franchise has expanded to over a hundred locations.
She is considering investing in a retail franchise.

english_meaning: in an honest and direct manner; frankly

examples.english: Frankly, I don't think this plan will work.
examples.turkish: Dürüstçe söylemek gerekirse, bu planın işe yarayacağını düşünmüyorum.

examples.english: She spoke frankly about her concerns.
Frankly, the performance was disappointing.

english_meaning: wrongful or criminal deception intended to result in financial or personal gain

examples.english: The company was accused of financial fraud.
He was convicted of fraud after a lengthy trial.
examples.turkish: Uzun süren bir davadan sonra dolandırıcılıktan suçlu bulundu.

examples.english: The investigation uncovered a large-scale fraud scheme.
examples.turkish: Soruşturma, geniş çaplı bir dolandırıcılık planını ortaya çıkardı.

english_meaning: without restriction; willingly

examples.english: She expressed her opinions freely during the meeting.
The information is freely available online.
He moves freely in his new environment.

english_meaning: occurring or done on many occasions, in many cases, or in quick succession

examples.english: He is a frequent visitor to the local library.
Frequent breaks can improve productivity.
examples.turkish: Sık sık ara vermek verimliliği artırabilir.

examples.english: The frequent meetings kept everyone informed.

english_meaning: a first-year student at a college or high school

examples.english: The freshman orientation helped new students adjust to college life.
examples.turkish: Birinci sınıf oryantasyonu, yeni öğrencilerin üniversite hayatına uyum sağlamalarına yardımcı oldu.

examples.english: As a freshman, he was eager to learn and participate.
examples.turkish: Birinci sınıf öğrencisi olarak öğrenmeye ve katılmaya hevesliydi.

examples.english: The university provides special programs for freshmen.
examples.turkish: Üniversite, birinci sınıf öğrencileri için özel programlar sunar.

english_meaning: feeling or expressing distress and annoyance, typically as a result of inability to change or achieve something

examples.english: He felt frustrated after several failed attempts.
examples.turkish: Birkaç başarısız denemeden sonra hayal kırıklığına uğradı.

examples.english: The constant delays made her increasingly frustrated.
examples.turkish: Sürekli gecikmeler onu giderek daha fazla hayal kırıklığına uğrattı.

examples.english: She was visibly frustrated with the lack of progress.
examples.turkish: İlerleme eksikliğinden dolayı belirgin şekilde hayal kırıklığı yaşadı.

english_meaning: causing annoyance or upset because of an inability to change or achieve something

examples.english: The constant interruptions were extremely frustrating.
examples.turkish: Sürekli kesintiler son derece sinir bozucuydu.

examples.english: It was frustrating to see progress stalled.
The technical glitches made the presentation frustrating.
examples.turkish: Teknik aksaklıklar sunumu sinir bozucu hale getirdi.

english_meaning: the feeling of being upset or annoyed, especially because of inability to change or achieve something

examples.english: Her constant delays led to growing frustration among the team.
examples.turkish: Sürekli gecikmeler, takım arasında artan hayal kırıklığına neden oldu.

examples.english: He expressed his frustration at the poor service.
examples.turkish: Kötü hizmetten dolayı hayal kırıklığını dile getirdi.

examples.english: Frustration is a natural response when goals are not met.
examples.turkish: Hedeflere ulaşılamadığında hayal kırıklığı doğal bir tepkidir.

english_meaning: to achieve or realize (something desired, promised, or predicted)

examples.english: She worked hard to fulfill her lifelong dream.
examples.turkish: Ömür boyu süren hayalini gerçekleştirmek için çok çalıştı.

examples.english: The project fulfilled all our expectations.
They fulfilled the conditions of the contract perfectly.
examples.turkish: Sözleşmenin şartlarını mükemmel bir şekilde yerine getirdiler.

english_meaning: occupying or using the whole of the available time; for the entire duration of a period

examples.english: She works full-time as a software engineer.
examples.turkish: O, tam zamanlı bir yazılım mühendisi olarak çalışıyor.

examples.english: They offer full-time support to all their customers.
examples.turkish: Tüm müşterilerine tam zamanlı destek sunuyorlar.

examples.english: He decided to become a full-time student.
examples.turkish: Tam zamanlı öğrenci olmaya karar verdi.

english_meaning: designed to be practical and useful rather than attractive; working and operating in a proper or particular way

examples.english: The new software is highly functional and user-friendly.
examples.turkish: Yeni yazılım son derece işlevsel ve kullanıcı dostudur.

examples.english: They redesigned the kitchen to make it more functional.
examples.turkish: Mutfak, daha kullanışlı olması için yeniden tasarlandı.

examples.english: A functional design is more important than decorative elements.
examples.turkish: İşlevsel bir tasarım, süsleyici öğelerden daha önemlidir.

english_meaning: in central or primary respects; basically

examples.english: The two theories are fundamentally different.
Her argument is fundamentally flawed.
The plan was fundamentally sound despite minor issues.
examples.turkish: Plan, küçük sorunlara rağmen temelde sağlamdı.

english_meaning: the process of seeking and gathering voluntary financial contributions

examples.english: The charity organized a fundraising event to support its programs.
examples.turkish: Hayır kurumu, programlarını desteklemek için bir para toplama etkinliği düzenledi.

examples.english: They launched an online fundraising campaign.
Fundraising is essential for non-profit organizations.
